title: [K-12] Exploring Politicality in Instructional Design: Critical Reflection on Educational Practices Through Text Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of foundational educational technology theories, instructional design methodologies, and science curriculum knowledge
context.additional_context: Focuses on fostering preservice teachers' critical design competencies to recognize internalized power structures and techno-cultural biases in instructional design processes and apply them to science curricular contexts.

learning_goals: Learners can apply a text analysis framework to examine cultural and political factors influencing instructional design processes
Learners can generate at least three critical questions identifying embedded power dynamics in science curriculum design
One can explain the impact of algorithmic instructional design on social inclusion and exclusion mechanisms through case-based analysis

resources: Science Curriculum Instructional Design Case Bank

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
